So I have a driver class which uses 

    import java.awt.*;
    import javax.swing.*;

It is essentially three tabs on a Layout manager. So there's one driver class and three other .java files with different tabs written as panels. Each tab has certain prices and items of different kinds. Now I know if I have one tab how I can implement buttonlisteners etc on THAT individual tab; for example something like this:

    private class ButtonListener implements ActionListener
    {
    public void actionPerformed (ActionEvent event)
    {
    count++;
    label.setText("Pushes: " + count);
    }
    }


What I need is:

Prices from all three tabs added together on one frame or new panel. I want to print the prices:

"Item 1 4.99"
"Item 2 10.99"

So how do I get information from separate panels onto one?

**Important: I am new to programming. So imagine someone who has only been programming for about a 1-3 months would not know too advanced concepts.


I have three tabs on a Layout manager. So there's one driver class and three other .java files with different tabs written as panels. Each tab has certain prices and items of different kinds. They are all using a grid layout. I want to take the prices from different tabs and add them up.

I want to add a panel or frame or something to add the prices up in my driver class. This is what my driver looks like:

    import java.awt.*;
    import javax.swing.*;
    
    public class pizza
    {
      private JLabel pricelabel;
      
      
       public static void main (String[] args)
       {
          JFrame frame = new JFrame ("Pizza");
          frame.setDefaultCloseOperation (JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
    
          JTabbedPane pizza = new JTabbedPane();
          pizza.addTab ("Pizza", new PizzaPanel());
          pizza.addTab ("Drinks", new DrinksPanel());
          pizza.addTab ("Specials", new SpecialsPanel());
    
          frame.getContentPane().add(pizza);
          frame.pack();
          frame.setVisible(true);
       }
    }

This is ONE of the tabs. See I put the prices there. They get added while the user presses the buttons. But they need to be added to the above class^. There's two others that are very much identical to this one outside of names and prices. :

    import java.awt.*;
    import javax.swing.*;
    
    
    public class PizzaPanel extends JPanel
    {
    double price;
    
    
       public PizzaPanel()
       {
          setLayout (new GridLayout (2, 3));
    
          setBackground (Color.red);
    
          JButton pl = new JButton ("Large Pepperoni: $7");
          JButton ps = new JButton ("Small Pepperoni: $4");
          JButton cl = new JButton ("Large Cheese: $6.50");
          JButton cs = new JButton ("Small Cheese: $3.50");
          JButton vl = new JButton ("Large Vegetable: $7");
          JButton vs = new JButton ("Small Vegetable: $4");
    
          add (pl);
          add (ps);
          add (cl);
          add (cs);
          add (vl);
          add (vs);
          
          
          
          pl.addActionListener(new ButtonListener());
          ps.addActionListener(new ButtonListener());
          cl.addActionListener(new ButtonListener());
          cs.addActionListener(new ButtonListener());
          vl.addActionListener(new ButtonListener());
          vs.addActionListener(new ButtonListener());
          
         
          
       }  
                 private class ButtonListener implements ActionListener
          {
    
                       public void actionPerformed (ActionEvent event)
                   {
                     if (event.getActionCommand().equals("Large Pepperoni: $7")) 
              
                         {
    
                           price+=7;
    
                          }else 
                
                    if(event.getActionCommand().equals("Small Pepperoni: $4")) 
              
                          {
    
                             price+=4
                             
                 
                           }else 
                
                      if (event.getActionCommand().equals("Large Cheese: $6.50")) 
                            {
    
                             price+=6.5
    
                            }else 
                            
                       if (event.getActionCommand().equals("Small Cheese: $3.50")) 
                            {
    
                             price+=3.5
    
                            }else 
                        if (event.getActionCommand().equals("Large Vegetable: $7")) 
                            {
    
                             price+=7
    
                            }else 
                            
                       if (event.getActionCommand().equals("Small Vegetable: $4")) 
                            {
    
                             price+=4
    
                            }
              
        }

**Important: I am new to programming. So imagine someone who has only been programming for about a 1-3 months would not know too advanced concepts.


I have three tabs on a Layout manager. So there's one driver class and three other .java files with different tabs written as panels. Each tab has certain prices and items of different kinds. They are all using a grid layout. I want to take the prices from different tabs and add them up.

I want to add a panel or frame or something to add the prices up in my driver class. This is what my driver looks like:

    import java.awt.*;
    import javax.swing.*;
    
    public class pizza
    {
      private JLabel pricelabel;
      
      
       public static void main (String[] args)
       {
          JFrame frame = new JFrame ("Pizza");
          frame.setDefaultCloseOperation (JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
    
          JTabbedPane pizza = new JTabbedPane();
          pizza.addTab ("Pizza", new PizzaPanel());
          pizza.addTab ("Drinks", new DrinksPanel());
          pizza.addTab ("Specials", new SpecialsPanel());
    
          frame.getContentPane().add(pizza);
          frame.pack();
          frame.setVisible(true);
       }
    }

This is ONE of the tabs. See I put the prices there. They get added while the user presses the buttons. But they need to be added to the above class^. There's two others that are very much identical to this one outside of names and prices. :

    import java.awt.*;
    import javax.swing.*;
    
    
    public class PizzaPanel extends JPanel
    {
    private double price;
    private JButton pl;
    private JButton ps;
    private JButton cl;
    private JButton cs;
    private JButton vl;
    private JButton vs;
    
    
    public double getPrice() 
       { return Price;
       }
    
    
       public PizzaPanel()
       {
          setLayout (new GridLayout (2, 3));
    
          setBackground (Color.red);
    
          pl = new JButton ("Large Pepperoni: $7");
          ps = new JButton ("Small Pepperoni: $4");
          cl = new JButton ("Large Cheese: $6.50");
          cs = new JButton ("Small Cheese: $3.50");
          vl = new JButton ("Large Vegetable: $7");
          vs = new JButton ("Small Vegetable: $4");
    
          add (pl);
          add (ps);
          add (cl);
          add (cs);
          add (vl);
          add (vs);
          
          
          
          pl.addActionListener(this);
          ps.addActionListener(this);
          cl.addActionListener(this);
          cs.addActionListener(this);
          vl.addActionListener(this);
          vs.addActionListener(this);
          
         
          
       }  
               
    
                       public void actionPerformed (ActionEvent e)
                   {
                     if (e.getSource().equals(pl)) 
              
                         {
    
                           price+=7;
                           System.out.println("$7.00");
    
                          }
                
                    if(e.getSource().equals(ps)) 
              
                          {
    
                             price+=4;
                             System.out.println("$4.00");
                 
                           } 
                
                      if (e.getSource().equals(cl)) 
                            {
    
                             price+=6.5;
                             System.out.println("$6.50");
    
                            }
                            
                       if (e.getSource().equals(cs)) 
                            {
                             price+=3.5;
                             System.out.println("$3.50");
    
                            } 
                        if (e.getSource().equals(vl)) 
                            {
    
                             price+=7;
                             System.out.println("$7.00");
    
                            }
                            
                       if (e.getSource().equals(vs)) 
                            {
    
                             price+=4;
                             System.out.println("$4.00");
    
                            }
              
            }}

I'm getting the following errors:

Also

**Important: I am new to programming. So imagine someone who has only been programming for about a 1-3 months would not know too advanced concepts.


This program runs right now, but I'm having trouble putting everything together. It's an ordering system for food. It uses tabs with grids in each. Each tabs has its own prices but follow the same exact logic.

 So far I have the buttons set up. I want to add to add the price of every item ordered to a total that is displayed to the customer. I know how to do this on only one tab, but how do I set this up so that it works across tabs?

          pizza.addTab ("Specials", new SpecialsPanel());

    }

So I'm very new to java.

This program runs right now. It's an ordering system for food. It uses tabs with grids in each. Each tabs has its own prices.

My problem is when I runs and compiles the program, it runs but the prices don't add up.
Basically, in the GUI class listed below, there's a method that takes the prices from each tab and adds them up....except it's not doing that. It does appear but the "$0.00" isn't changing.

This is the main class:

    import javax.swing.JFrame;
    
    public class Pizzamain
    {
    
    
         public static void main (String[] args)
       {
          JFrame frame = new JFrame ("Pizza Mutt Ordering Service");
          frame.setDefaultCloseOperation (JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
          frame.getContentPane().add(new PizzaMuttPanel());
          frame.pack();
          frame.setVisible(true);
          
          
        }
       
    }

This class holds all the GUI. It also adds up the prices in each tab.

    import java.awt.*;
    import javax.swing.*;
    import java.awt.event.*;
    import java.text.NumberFormat;
    
    public class PizzaMuttPanel extends JPanel
    {
        private JLabel totalLabel;
       private double total;
       
       
    
        
        public PizzaMuttPanel()
       {
          setLayout (new BorderLayout());
          
          JLabel name = new JLabel("Pizza Mutt Ordering Service WOOF! WOOF!");
          JPanel namePanel = new JPanel();
          namePanel.add(name);
          add(namePanel, BorderLayout.NORTH);
          
          JTabbedPane mainTabPane = new JTabbedPane();
          mainTabPane.add("Pizza", new PizzaPanel());
          mainTabPane.add("Drinks", new DrinksPanel());
          mainTabPane.add("Specials", new SpecialsPanel());
          add(mainTabPane, BorderLayout.CENTER);
          
          total = 0.0;
          JPanel totalPanel = new JPanel();
          totalPanel.add (new JLabel("Your total is:"));
          totalLabel = new JLabel("$0.00");
          totalPanel.add(totalLabel);
          add(totalPanel, BorderLayout.SOUTH);
    
          }
    
    
    
       public void addTotal (double intake)
       {
          total += intake;
          NumberFormat dollars = NumberFormat.getCurrencyInstance();
          totalLabel.setText(dollars.format(total));
       }
    }

This an example of one of the tabs. Btw, ALL the tabs follow this logic. As you can see, in the action section, there's something that adds prices each time a button is pressed then relays the data to the GUI class.

          vl.addActionListener(new ButtonListener());
